dict.string: One of the most recognizable hikes in the world, the Appalachian trail stretches across 14 states and 2200 miles, giving travelers an ever changing view of the great american wilderness.

Located on the pilgrimage route to the shrine of the apostle St. James the Great, the Camino De Santiago acts as a walk of spirituality for the hundreds of thousands of travelers that visit each year.
Traveling through the fabled “Five Lands” along the coast of Italy, the Cinque Terre trail offers a glimpse into a world where humans have found a harmony with nature.
The longest man-made structure in the world has stood the test of time over the last 2200 years. Less than a handful of individuals can claim to have walked it in its entirety.
Seen by many as one of the top 5 treks in the world, the Inca Trail combines nature and history into one beautiful journey, ending in the ancient city of Machu Picchu, 2430 meters above sea level.
